Through original programming, documentaries, and expert-led discussions, MHTN aims to increase awareness, provide valuable information, and encourage open conversations about mental well-being.

programme.title: Quo Vadis TV
programme.desc: Quo Vadis TV is committed to sharing the Biblical message in a way that makes Christian living practical, realistic, and attainable. Our theme is summarized the question: "where are you going?" Our Aim with this inquiry is to help people find orientation and find the path back to God.

programme.title: Focus

programme.title: The Real Charlie Chaplin
programme.desc: (2021) Documentary. Who was Charlie Chaplin? A simple enough question on the surface of it. But dig a bit deeper and separating the man from the character he played is a little trickier...

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: (1954) Crime-comedy starring Alec Guinness. A priest is tasked with accompanying a priceless religious artifact from London to Rome. But the prolific thief Flambeau is hot on his trail...

programme.title: Saraband for Dead Lovers
programme.desc: (1948) Historical drama starring Joan Greenwood and Stewart Granger. Princess Dorothea marries the future king of England. But then she meets a Swedish count...

programme.title: Nicholas Nickleby
programme.desc: (1947) Drama with Derek Bond, based on Charles Dickens' novel. After his father dies, Nicholas seeks the help of his cold, avaricious, scheming uncle. Predictably, it doesn't go well.

programme.title: The Colditz Story
programme.desc: (1954) Classic Second World War drama. John Mills, Lionel Jeffries and Bryan Forbes star as just some of the POWs determined to break out of the infamous German 'escape-proof' prison.

programme.title: Fisherman's Friends
programme.desc: (2019) Heart-warming comedy based on the real-life story of the Cornish folk ensemble who took the UK charts by storm in 2010, starring Daniel Mays and Tuppence Middleton.

programme.title: Boston Strangler
programme.desc: (2023) Keira Knightley stars as Loretta McLaughlin, the reporter who fought 60s chauvinism to break the story of the notorious titular serial killer, in Matt Ruskin's true crime procedural.

programme.title: She Said
programme.desc: (2022) Fact-based drama with Zoe Kazan and Carey Mulligan. New York Times journalists Jodi Kantor and Megan Twohey investigate the sexual abuses of Hollywood producer Harvey Weinstein.

programme.title: French Exit
programme.desc: (2020) Comedy drama with Michelle Pfeiffer. A skint Manhattan socialite moves to Paris with her son and a cat... which may or may not contain the spirit of her dead husband.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Sound Barrier
programme.desc: (1952) Drama starring Ralph Richardson as a pioneering aviator determined to break the sound barrier, even if it means risking the lives of those closest to him. Directed by David Lean.

programme.title: Gideon of Scotland Yard
programme.desc: (1958) Drama. Jack Hawkins stars as Police Inspector Gideon, who faces outrage and danger in his quest to bring London's criminals to justice. With Anna Massey, John Loder and Cyril Cusack.

programme.title: Animal Farm
programme.desc: (1954) George Orwell's cautionary tale reimagined in cartoon form. A farm's animals revolt against their abusive owner only for the pigs to become drunk with their newly found power.

programme.title: Footsteps in the Fog
programme.desc: (1955) Atmospheric Victorian melodrama. Stewart Granger plays a sinister aristocrat who poisons his wife. However, his maid (Jean Simmons) knows his secret and tries to use it against him.

programme.title: Legends of the Fall
programme.desc: (1994) Oscar-winning turn-of-the-century drama with Brad Pitt and Anthony Hopkins. A Montana patriarch's son falls for his brother's fiancée, setting off a tragic chain of events.

programme.title: American Gangster Special
programme.desc: Denzel Washington, Russell Crowe and director Ridley Scott talk about making American Gangster, the 2007 crime epic based on an unlikely true story.

programme.title: American Gangster
programme.desc: (2007) True crime thriller directed by Ridley Scott. An outcast New York cop (Russell Crowe) is charged with bringing down entrepreneurial Harlem drug lord Frank Lucas (Denzel Washington).

programme.title: The Mechanic
programme.desc: (2011) Thriller with Jason Statham and Donald Sutherland. A hitman is ordered to kill his mentor, but then takes on the dead man's son as an apprentice. Could get complicated... and deadly.

programme.title: A Quiet Place Part II
programme.desc: (2020) Hushed-horror sequel with Emily Blunt and Cillian Murphy. Armed only with a hearing aid, can the family evade the vicious aliens with super-hearing, and find a community to live in?

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Wonder Park
programme.desc: (2019) Animated adventure featuring the voices of Jennifer Garner, Mila Kunis, John Oliver and Matthew Broderick. A girl's imaginary theme park comes to life when her mum goes to hospital.

programme.title: Spies in Disguise
programme.desc: (2019) Animated spy comedy caper with the voice of Will Smith. The 'world's most awesome spy' gets framed and has to go undercover as a pigeon to prove his innocence.

programme.title: The Desert Fox
programme.desc: (1951) Drama. James Mason stars in Henry Hathaway's sympathetic portrait of Field Marshal Erwin Rommel in the final years of his life during the Second World War. With Jessica Tandy.

programme.title: The Perfect Catch
programme.desc: (2005) Comedy. Ben (Jimmy Fallon) must choose between his two loves: Lindsey (Drew Barrymore) and the Boston Red Sox baseball team. Based on Nick Hornby's novel Fever Pitch.

programme.title: The Day After Tomorrow
programme.desc: (2004) Tense sci-fi thriller starring Jake Gyllenhaal and Dennis Quaid. A scientist sets out to save his son when global warming plunges the world into a sudden climatic catastrophe.

programme.title: The King's Man
programme.desc: (2021) The spy-caper franchise continues with the origins story of the Kingsman agency, as a plucky group battle an international conspiracy at the outbreak of WWI. With Ralph Fiennes.

programme.title: Scream
programme.desc: (2022) Meta-comedy horror 're-quel' with Courteney Cox. Killer Ghostface returns to shock the younger generation out of their love of 'elevated horror' with a bit of old-fashioned slashing.

programme.title: Dead of Night
programme.desc: (1945) Five uncanny tales of the supernatural in one eerie package, the most famous starring ventriloquist Michael Redgrave and a deadly dummy. Prepare to be spooked.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Henry VIII and His Six Wives
programme.desc: (1972) Historical drama with Keith Michell as Henry VIII, nobly supported by Donald Pleasance, Charlotte Rampling and Jane Asher. The dying monarch reviews his own life.

programme.title: Oblivion Interview Special
programme.desc: Tom Cruise talks about making the sci-fi-adventure Oblivion.

programme.title: Local Hero
programme.desc: (1983) Comedy starring Peter Riegert, Burt Lancaster and Peter Capaldi. A US oil company executive tries to persuade a small Scottish seaside community to sell up their entire village.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Fallout...
programme.desc: ...Interview Special: Tom Cruise, Rebecca Ferguson, Henry Cavill, Simon Pegg, Vanessa Kirby and director Christopher McQuarrie talk about making the sixth instalment in the thriller series.

programme.title: Midway
programme.desc: (2019) Roland Emmerich's sprawling, action-packed war drama about the Battle of Midway, a major turning point in World War II. Starring Ed Skrein, Luke Evans and Woody Harrelson.

programme.title: Oblivion
programme.desc: (2013) Sci-fi action-mystery set on a war-ravaged planet Earth that's been largely abandoned by humanity. With Tom Cruise, Andrea Riseborough, Olga Kurylenko and Morgan Freeman.

programme.title: Good Luck to You, Leo Grande
programme.desc: (2022) Drama starring Emma Thompson as a recently widowed, retired teacher who has a sexual bucket list she wants to get around to now that she has the time and, perhaps, even the energy.

programme.title: Hunter Killer
programme.desc: (2018) Nautical action thriller. Gerard Butler stars as an unconventional submarine skipper sent to investigate the torpedoing of a US vessel. With Gary Oldman, Linda Cardellini and Common.

programme.title: Minari
programme.desc: (2020) Moving drama. In the 1980s, the Yi family move to rural Arkansas to live the American Dream. But the reality is harsh and the family are soon struggling to survive. In Korean/subs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: LumoTV: You, Me
programme.desc: Drama. A charming family story of how a young deaf girl learns that Santa is not deaf.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Young Winston
programme.desc: (1972) Biopic charting the rise of the future PM from battered Harrow pupil to MP via military action on foreign soil. Directed by Richard Attenborough.

programme.title: Two Way Stretch
programme.desc: (1960) Comedy. Peter Sellers, Bernard Cribbins and David Lodge star as criminals happily incarcerated in a prison run like a home-from-home for old lags and rascals by a liberal governor.

programme.title: Far from the Madding Crowd
programme.desc: (1967) Julie Christie and Terence Stamp star in John Schlesinger's adaptation of Thomas Hardy's novel. Bathsheba is not short of suitors, but will marrying any of them lead to happiness?

programme.title: All That Heaven Allows
programme.desc: Predicated on a May-December romance. The difference here is that the woman, attractive widow Cary Scott (Jane Wyman), is considerably older than the man, handsome gardener-landscaper Ron Kirby (Rock Hudson). Throwing conventional behavior to the winds and facing social ostracism, Cary pursues her romance with Ron, who is unjustly perceived as a fortune-hunter by Cary's friends and family -- especially her priggish brother Ned (William Reynolds).

programme.title: Bundle of Joy
programme.desc: When department store clerk Polly Parish (Debbie Reynolds) finds an abandoned baby, she unwittingly falls victim to her gossip-crazed coworkers. Even store owner John Merlin (Adolphe Menjou) assumes the baby is hers, and then goes so far as to demand that his son Dan (Eddie Fisher) step in and "do the right thing." Caught up in the moment -- and eager to spend time with the hunky younger Merlin -- Parish plays along. As Parish and Dan grow closer, she struggles to keep the truth from him.

programme.title: The Passionate Friends
programme.desc: In this drama, based on the H.G. Wells novel, Mary (Ann Todd) longs for Steven (Trevor Howard), a lover she turned down years ago. Later, Mary is married to Howard (Claude Rains), but meets up with Steven while on vacation in the Swiss Alps. A seemingly platonic encounter fueled by pent-up passion leads to an affair between Mary and Steven, and she must choose between the two men -- the husband who loves her and the now-married man she rejected years earlier.

programme.title: The Lonesome Trail
programme.desc: A group of conniving land-grabbers is deterred from further evil by a Western Robin Hood armed with a bow and arrow.

programme.title: Bonanza Town
programme.desc: The Durango Kid learns that a supposedly dead outlaw is alive and well and in cahoots with a corrupt town boss.

programme.title: A Lawless Street
programme.desc: The honorable Calem Ware (Randolph Scott), marshal of the Wild West boomtown of Medicine Bend, attempts to defuse the simmering tensions in his rapidly growing and increasingly violent town, as a greedy businessman (Warner Anderson) hires a sinister black-gloved gunman (Michael Pate) to take care of his problems with the marshal for good. Meanwhile, a traveling song-and-dance troupe arrives in town, bearing Ware's lost love, Tally (Angela Lansbury), who holds the secret to his violent past.

programme.title: Westbound
programme.desc: A former Union officer, John Hayes (Randolph Scott) now manages a stagecoach company. However, Clay Putnam (Andrew Duggan), a businessman still loyal to the South, is intent on robbing the coaches operated by Hayes, which transport gold to the North from California. Hoping to heist the treasure as a way to revive the Confederacy, Putnam also has a grudge against Hayes, since his wife, Norma (Virginia Mayo), was once involved with the handsome Union soldier.

programme.title: All Mine to Give
programme.desc: In this fact-based drama set in the 1850s, the Eunsons move from Scotland to the American Midwest, where they live happily and run a successful business -- until the untimely deaths of both the father (Cameron Mitchell) and the mother (Glynis Johns) of the family. Now orphaned, the six Eunson kids must fend for themselves. Robbie (Rex Thompson), the oldest, does his best to care for his siblings while he searches for foster parents kind enough to accept such a large family into their home.

programme.title: Tenth Avenue Angel
programme.desc: Eight-year-old Flavia Mills (Margaret O'Brien) lives in a tenement building in New York City with her family. Her aunt, Susan (Angela Lansbury), awaits the return of her fiancé, Steve (George Murphy), who has been in prison. Upon Steve's return, Flavia tries to help him regain her aunt's love and find his place in society. But, when Flavia learns the truth about Steve's criminal past, her faith in humanity is brought into question, and she must try to face adversity with her usual optimism.

programme.desc: A World War I veteran (Gordon MacRae) makes his Indiana sweetheart (Doris Day) wait for marriage while he makes money.

programme.desc: An undercover Army captain (James Millican) links missing gold and murder to a gambler's (Reed Hadley) ghost.

programme.title: The Tall Texan
programme.desc: Sheriff Chadbourne (Samuel Herrick) transports convict Ben Trask (Lloyd Bridges) to El Paso in a covered wagon. The wagon also carries sea captain Theodore Bess (Lee J. Cobb) and married couple Laura (Marie Windsor) and Jerry Niblett (Dean Train). The group comes upon a wounded Native American, banished by his tribe, who offers to lead them to gold. But then the tribe attacks the wagon, killing Jerry and wounding Chadbourne. Ben is freed to help, but the group's troubles have only begun.

programme.title: Westbound
programme.desc: A former Union officer, John Hayes (Randolph Scott) now manages a stagecoach company. However, Clay Putnam (Andrew Duggan), a businessman still loyal to the South, is intent on robbing the coaches operated by Hayes, which transport gold to the North from California. Hoping to heist the treasure as a way to revive the Confederacy, Putnam also has a grudge against Hayes, since his wife, Norma (Virginia Mayo), was once involved with the handsome Union soldier.

programme.title: The Rounders
programme.desc: Ben Jones (Glenn Ford) and Howdy Lewis (Henry Fonda) are cowboys who spend their days breaking horses and flirting with two sisters (Kathleen Freeman, Joan Freeman). When Ben and Howdy trade Ol' Fooler, an unbreakable horse, for corn liquor, the client returns the horse after it passes out from drinking whiskey. The cowboys grow fond of Ol' Fooler and, knowing that he is nearly impossible to ride, enter the horse in the rodeo hoping to make their fortune.

programme.title: The Trouble With Angels
programme.desc: Mary (Hayley Mills) and her friend, Rachel (June Harding), are new students at St. Francis Academy, a boarding school run by the iron fist of Mother Superior (Rosalind Russell). The immature teens grow bored and begin playing pranks on both the unsuspecting nuns and their unpleasant classmates, becoming a constant thorn in Mother Superior's side. However, as the years pass, Mary and Rachel slowly mature and begin to see the nuns in a different light.

programme.title: Young at Heart
programme.desc: Gregory Tuttle (Robert Keith), a widowed musician, is the father of three extraordinarily gifted daughters, Laurie (Doris Day), Fran (Dorothy Malone) and Amy (Elisabeth Fraser), all of whom are facing different romantic troubles. The arrival of two handsome musicians, Alex Burke (Gig Young) and Barney Sloan (Frank Sinatra), who have been invited by Gregory to board at the house while working on a new musical, further complicates the daughters' love lives.

programme.title: Stolen Face
programme.desc: A plastic surgeon (Paul Henreid) makes a convict look like the pianist (Lizabeth Scott) he loves, then marries her.

The immature teens grow bored and begin playing pranks on both the unsuspecting nuns and their unpleasant classmates, becoming a constant thorn in Mother Superior's side. However, as the years pass, Mary and Rachel slowly mature and begin to see the nuns in a different light.

programme.title: Young at Heart
programme.desc: Gregory Tuttle (Robert Keith), a widowed musician, is the father of three extraordinarily gifted daughters, Laurie (Doris Day), Fran (Dorothy Malone) and Amy (Elisabeth Fraser), all of whom are facing different romantic troubles. The arrival of two handsome musicians, Alex Burke (Gig Young) and Barney Sloan (Frank Sinatra), who have been invited by Gregory to board at the house while working on a new musical, further complicates the daughters' love lives.

programme.title: Cattle Queen of Montana
programme.desc: When defiant female rancher Sierra Nevada Jones (Barbara Stanwyck) sweeps into Montana, she receives a hostile welcome from a tribe of Native Americans who attack her cattle and leave her father dead. Kindly Indian brave Colorados (Lance Fuller) and government officer Farrell (Ronald Reagan) help Sierra fight for her land against treacherous locals like the envious Tom McCord (Gene Evans), a neighboring rancher determined to cheat Jones out of her property and drive her back to Texas.

programme.title: Both Barrels Blazing
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) shoots holes in a scheme to ship stolen gold.

programme.title: North From the Lone Star
programme.desc: Wild Bill Hickok (Bill Elliott) puts on a badge to clean up a town.

programme.title: The Rounders
programme.desc: Ben Jones (Glenn Ford) and Howdy Lewis (Henry Fonda) are cowboys who spend their days breaking horses and flirting with two sisters (Kathleen Freeman, Joan Freeman). When Ben and Howdy trade Ol' Fooler, an unbreakable horse, for corn liquor, the client returns the horse after it passes out from drinking whiskey. The cowboys grow fond of Ol' Fooler and, knowing that he is nearly impossible to ride, enter the horse in the rodeo hoping to make their fortune.

programme.title: Across the Wide Missouri
programme.desc: Tough trapper Flint Mitchell (Clark Gable) is a tenacious survivor in the unforgiving wilderness of the West. Determined to stay on the good side of the local Blackfoot tribe, Flint is intent on marrying Kamiah (Maria Elena Marques), the beautiful daughter of Ironshirt (Ricardo Montalban) -- especially since this union would allow him to freely pursue his trade in the region. Struggling to win the approval of the protective Ironshirt, Flint finds himself truly falling for Kamiah.

programme.title: Fitzwilly
programme.desc: In this clever 1960s comedy, tireless and loyal butler Fitzwilly (Dick Van Dyke) hides from his eccentric spinster boss, Victoria Woodhouse (Edith Evans), the fact that she has been bankrupt since her father died. Through wily schemes with his fellow servants, he creates one racket, swindle or con after another to maintain the household and fund his employer's frivolous philanthropy. When new secretary Juliet (Barbara Feldon) is hired on, Fitzwilly's life gets even more complicated.

programme.title: Christmas Eve
programme.desc: Matilda Reid (Ann Harding) is in danger of being declared senile at the urging of her nephew, Phillip (Reginald Denny). To keep him from controlling her estate, Matilda must find her three adopted sons, who left home long ago. One of them, Michael (George Brent), lives in New York, where he's incurred a $75,000 debt. Another, fugitive Mario (George Raft), is hiding in South America. The last, Jonathan (Randolph Scott), is a small-time cowboy. All three must come home to save Matilda's fortune.

programme.title: Tomorrow
programme.desc: In 1930s Mississippi, lonely Jackson Fentry (Robert Duvall) lives by himself as the sole caretaker of a sawmill. One day, close to the property, he discovers a young woman, Sarah Eubanks (Olga Bellin), who is three months pregnant. Since she was abandoned by both her husband and her family, Jackson takes her in. The two fall in love and get married just before her death. Jackson raises the child as his own, until the boy's uncles arrive to demand he be returned to the family.

programme.title: Arizona Stagecoach
programme.desc: The Range Busters (Ray Corrigan, John King, Max Terhune) go after some bad guys.

programme.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: Holmes and Watson try to trace an undetectable murder weapon.

programme.title: Tulsa
programme.desc: Stuart Heisler's film is set during the 20s Oklahoma oil boom. Cherokee Lansing, daughter of a rancher killed by the oilmen, is determined to get her revenge by finding oil before they can. Helped by native American Jim Redbird and roustabout Brad Brady she strikes it rich, but her greed sees her and oilman Bruce Tanner become partners.

programme.title: Ministry - Your Words Have Power with Joyce Meyer
programme.desc: Your words hold incredible power; today, Joyce reveals how the things you say can impact your life in profound ways.

programme.title: Word of God Ministries
programme.desc: Pastor James McMenis and his wife Chrissy are dedicated to winning the lost to Jesus and making disciples of the saved. Their goal is to bring clarity to the Word of God, making it life-applicable to people everywhere.

programme.title: The Catholic Mass
programme.desc: The Heart of the nation Sunday mass brings the beauty and traditions of the Catholic faith.

programme.title: Perry Stone
programme.desc: Religious teachings from Perry Stone.

programme.title: Paid Programming
programme.desc: Paid programming.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: Broke journalist Ned Buntline enlists Earp's help when he arrives in Dodge City and claims a crooked gambler wants him dead; Earp meets an undercover officer who believes the gambler may instead be in town to sell stolen guns to the Apache.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: When Earp learns of a plot against his life, he avoids speaking at a convention held in the Dodge City Opera House and increases security, but as pressure builds for him to speak, Judge Tobin and Mayor Kelley wonder if Earp can still do his job.

programme.title: Fitzwilly
programme.desc: In this clever 1960s comedy, tireless and loyal butler Fitzwilly (Dick Van Dyke) hides from his eccentric spinster boss, Victoria Woodhouse (Edith Evans), the fact that she has been bankrupt since her father died. Through wily schemes with his fellow servants, he creates one racket, swindle or con after another to maintain the household and fund his employer's frivolous philanthropy. When new secretary Juliet (Barbara Feldon) is hired on, Fitzwilly's life gets even more complicated.

programme.title: Christmas Eve
programme.desc: Matilda Reid (Ann Harding) is in danger of being declared senile at the urging of her nephew, Phillip (Reginald Denny). To keep him from controlling her estate, Matilda must find her three adopted sons, who left home long ago. One of them, Michael (George Brent), lives in New York, where he's incurred a $75,000 debt. Another, fugitive Mario (George Raft), is hiding in South America. The last, Jonathan (Randolph Scott), is a small-time cowboy. All three must come home to save Matilda's fortune.

programme.title: Across the Wide Missouri
programme.desc: Tough trapper Flint Mitchell (Clark Gable) is a tenacious survivor in the unforgiving wilderness of the West. Determined to stay on the good side of the local Blackfoot tribe, Flint is intent on marrying Kamiah (Maria Elena Marques), the beautiful daughter of Ironshirt (Ricardo Montalban) -- especially since this union would allow him to freely pursue his trade in the region. Struggling to win the approval of the protective Ironshirt, Flint finds himself truly falling for Kamiah.

programme.title: Gun Glory
programme.desc: Life is anything but sweet when roaming gunfighter Tom Early (Stewart Granger) returns home. His wife has died, and his son (Steve Rowland) now barely speaks to him. Things aren't much different in town, where Early tangles with the posse of a cattle baron (James Gregory) who vows to run a herd of 20,000 roughshod through the settlers' land. Early must somewhat reluctantly play the role of defender, especially after a foolhardy plan by the local preacher (Chill Wills) goes awry.

programme.title: Little Women
programme.desc: The March sisters -- Meg (Janet Leigh), Jo (June Allyson), Beth (Margaret O'Brien) and Amy (Elizabeth Taylor) -- struggle to make ends meet in their New England household while their father is away fighting in the Civil War. Despite harsh times, they cling to optimism, often with neighbor Laurie (Peter Lawford) as a companion. As they mature, they face burgeoning ambitions and relationships, as well as tragedy, all the while maintaining their unbreakable bond.

programme.title: Holiday Affair
programme.desc: Charming seasonal clerk Steve Mason (Robert Mitchum) catches beautiful Connie Ennis (Janet Leigh) in a fraudulent shopping scheme during the busy Christmas rush. But when he discovers that Ennis is a war widow and single mother, Mason takes pity on her and can't bring himself to turn her in. His supervisor takes notice and fires him on the spot. Mason befriends Connie and her young son, Timmy (Gordon Gebert), and may complicate her plans to marry boring nice guy Carl Davis (Wendell Corey).

programme.title: Henry V
programme.desc: Olivier's masterful, sweeping rendition of Shakespeare, filmed in rich color and ingeniously including a typical performance at the Globe Theatre as it might have been seen 400 years ago. The film earned Olivier a special Oscar for outstanding achievement as actor, producer and director.

programme.title: Satan's Cradle
programme.desc: The Cisco Kid (Duncan Renaldo) and Pancho (Leo Carrillo) flush out a crooked lawyer and his girlfriend (Ann Savage).

programme.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: A battered hat and a Christmas goose are Holmes' only clues to clearing a falsely accused man.

programme.title: Paid Programming
programme.desc: Paid programming.

programme.title: Daniel Boone
programme.desc: The frontiersman (George O'Brien) leads settlers to Kentucky, where a white renegade (John Carradine) unites tribes against them.

programme.title: Through the Bible With Les Feldick
programme.desc: Les Feldick, an Oklahoma farmer and rancher with a special gift for teaching the Bible; his simple and nondenominational approach on the program "Through the Bible with Les Feldick" has reached millions around the world with the Gospel of Grace.

programme.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: Holmes links a murder in a quiet English house to a Chicago gangster.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: A gang coerces a woman into courting Earp to learn information about a gold shipment they plan to rob, but Bat and Mayor Kelley see through the ruse.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: When Earp and Bat leave town to arrest train robbers, Hal Norton must wrangle the remaining deputies to deal with numerous problems that spring up in Dodge City while the ever-doubtful Mayor Kelley seeks to replace him.

programme.title: Little Women
programme.desc: The March sisters -- Meg (Janet Leigh), Jo (June Allyson), Beth (Margaret O'Brien) and Amy (Elizabeth Taylor) -- struggle to make ends meet in their New England household while their father is away fighting in the Civil War. Despite harsh times, they cling to optimism, often with neighbor Laurie (Peter Lawford) as a companion. As they mature, they face burgeoning ambitions and relationships, as well as tragedy, all the while maintaining their unbreakable bond.

programme.desc: The abandoned boat dilemma is one of the most frustrating and alarming issues facing British Columbia's coastal communities. Reaching the end of their life cycle, with limited disposal options and almost no way to track ownership, hundreds of old boats are being left to rot, and sink or drift onto beaches and shorelines around our province. The result is a province-wide problem that affect coastal navigation, tourism and the environment. Abandoned Dreams looks into the root causes of this derel.

programme.desc: With the entire country experiencing the worst wildfire season in history, the Duz Cho Logging crew races to place a critical bridge on the block; after two months off, Freya Logging moves into their summer block under the threat of a shutdown.

programme.title: Heavy Rescue: 401
programme.desc: The pressure is on for Steve when a flipped truck blocks access to the airport; Coxon fights a wreck with a toxic payload; a wild rollover rips a cab off its chassis and leaves a trail of destruction for the Ross crew.

programme.title: Heavy Rescue: 401
programme.desc: A heavy wreck and a frustrating recovery threaten to overwhelm Kevin; after a big change in his career, Sonny struggles to make a mark when a heavy load flips in the middle of the city.

programme.title: Heavy Rescue: 401
programme.desc: After three decades on the highway, a major change forces Eric Godard to adapt to a new crew on a tough rollover; a vicious pre-winter storm pushes Sonny into urgent on-the-job training; a jet fuel spill shuts down the entire 401.

programme.title: Heavy Rescue: 401
programme.desc: When a tanker bursts open east of Toronto, a young operator faces a toxic mess; Gary reacts fast when he spots a dangerous mistake on the road; a rookie takes the controls for his first heavy job.

programme.title: Think Big
programme.desc: Children are the future -- and so are their inventions, which is why "Think Big" could be an important show. It features young inventors competing to see who can come up with the most-innovative invention. Each episode features two teams in the Think Tank -- a studio filled with art supplies and construction materials -- who brainstorm and choose materials before sketching, designing and building a prototype to be presented to a judge, who determines a winner. The champions earn bragging rights and the coveted Genius Cup.

programme.title: America's Heartland
programme.desc: Much of the food Americans eat is produced by farmers and ranchers in the country's heartland, but many people don't know how it's produced. "America's Heartland" provides information about the people and processes responsible for the availability of food and fuel across the country and around the world. The show's reporters and producers tell stories in topics that include farm families, consumer issues, animal welfare and crop sustainability. Some episodes also take the show abroad to countries such as Egypt and Taiwan to show the impact American agriculture has on the global economy.

programme.title: Hellgate
programme.desc: After the Civil War, ranch owner Gil Hanley helps a stranger in desperate need of medical attention. Soon he is questioned by Union soldiers about the stranger, who turns out to be an ex-Confederate soldier. Hanley, also an ex-Confederate, is unjustly convicted as a conspirator and sentenced to life in a brutal desert prison in New Mexico. After battling his tough cellmate and a sadistic guard, Hanley tries to stop a plague from overwhelming the prison.

programme.title: Justice With Judge Mablean
programme.desc: Judge Mablean Ephriam, who presided over "Divorce Court" from 1999-2006 as the first star of the revived version of the show, returns to the courtroom genre with his half-hour series that deals with life and the law. The former Los Angeles-based prosecutor takes on the typical cases that are found on TV court shows. The arbitrator says that her show "will be life because everything we do, it involves the law."

programme.title: The Verdict With Judge Hatchett
programme.desc: Judge Glenda Hatchett presided over her self-titled courtroom show from 2000-2008. Now, she returns to the medium with "The Verdict." In the half-hour series, the Atlanta native and former juvenile-court judge rules over small-claims cases brought in front of her. Hatchett's courtroom isn't just about finding someone guilty, though. She also uses her experience dealing with young people and her tough-love approach to help send a message to out-of-control juvenile offenders to try to set them on the right track in their lives.

As usual with court shows, cases involve friendships gone bad, money disputes and property damage.

programme.desc: The Corrupter: Detective drama. When the owner of a jewellery company is mugged and murdered on the street, Kojak suspects that it is no ordinary crime and is soon proven right. S1 Ep7

programme.title: Magnum, P.I.
programme.desc: Black on White: Classic US action drama series. Rick and Thomas learn that members of Higgins' former regiment are being targeted by Mau-Mau warriors out for revenge. S3 Ep6

programme.title: Magnum, P.I.
programme.desc: Flashback: Classic US action drama series. Thomas finds himself mysteriously whisked back in time to the 1930s where he is hired by a woman seeking to clear her father's name. S3 Ep7

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: Slush Fund: CI5 investigates the criminal behaviour of a European consortium which is building a fighter plane branded as a potential death-trap. S3 Ep11

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Pandora's Box: US documentary series. Mike and Frank are delighted when they visit a house packed with rare collectables, but they are less pleased by the prices being asked for. S4 Ep6

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Sharpe's Rifles: Napoleonic War-based action-adventure. After saving the life of Sir Arthur Wellesley, Sergeant Richard Sharpe is rewarded with a mission to locate a missing agent. S1 Ep1

programme.title: Newsline
programme.desc: Bianca de la Garza tackles the big news from D.C., N.Y., across America, and around the world.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S1 E8 The Avenger Hoss and Joe desperately look for a way to prevent brothers Adam and Ben from being hanged for a crime. A stranger, Lassiter, comes to town in an attempt to find the truth and prove Adam and Ben's innocence.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E11 The Legacy Lucas agrees to do a good deed for Pop, the town drunk who is dying, by going along with a story that his ranch is owned by Pop. When Pop's son, Philip, arrives from back east the story backfires and now his son wants restitution.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E12 The Baby Sitter A dance hall singer asks for Lucas' help in hiding her 6-month-old baby girl from her estranged, self-righteous husband after he comes to town demanding she give the baby to him. Lucas must deal with the consequences of safeguarding the infant.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E13 The Coward George Collins, a meek young man who loves to write, moves west for adventure. However, he is soon fired as a trail cook and beaten up by trailhands. Lucas takes George under his wing to help him discover his true qualities and inner strength.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E14 Surveyors Mark overhears men plotting to rob the North Fork Bank while at a surveying camp and tells Lucas about what he heard. When Lucas questions his story, Mark runs away from home. Lucas later learns Mark was telling the truth and helps capture the men.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S7 E6 Keep Them Doggies Rollin' The cowboys make a second attempt at rounding up their neighbor's unruly herd, and this time they come out on top as they finally manage to get the cattle penned up. Booger overcomes a number of obstacles in order to pull off an old-fashioned cattle drive right through the center of town. With a number of townsfolk along for the ride, it's slow going, but if he can impress the mayor, it just might become an annual event. Grandma gives the wives a lesson in cowgirl cooking, as they prepare swamp cabbage for the hungry cowboys on the cattle drive.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S7 E7 Northern Exposure In the midst of a drought, the cowboys go in search of greener pastures and travel to northern Alabama in hopes of establishing a partnership with a successful rancher. Back at home, Misty decides to sell her beloved barrel horse to a junior racer, and she's so impressed by the young girl's positive attitude that she offers to give her some barrel racing lessons. Bubba splits his time between training his new ranch horses and coming to Kaley's aid during her difficult pregnancy. Booger decides to honor Grandma by compiling a cookbook full of her famous cowgirl recipes and stories.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E25 None So Blind Mark befriends Lafayette Blye, a blind banjo-playing man. Blye tells Mark he's hunting the man responsible for his blindness. Meanwhile, veterinarian John J. Mack tells Lucas he needs to destroy his herd. It turns out Mack is the man Blye is seeking.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E26 Jealous Man Micah's friends, Jake Owens, and his pretty wife, Fay, are Lucas' new neighbors. Jake is wildly jealous of Fay and wrongly imagines Lucas and Fay are having a romance. Jake soon threatens to kill Lucas, which almost leads to his own death instead.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E2 The Spirit of Truth After his fur trapping expedition is surprised by a Crow war party, legendary mountain man Jim Bridger suddenly finds himself in a desperate struggle to rescue his fellow trappers when one of them goes missing, and another is on the brink of madness.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E3 The Fossil Feud When bloodthirsty Canadian trappers try to kill him, mountain man Jim Bridger takes cover in an unexplored valley. There, he runs headlong into a family of escaped slaves who show him the huge footprints and fossilized bones of long-dead monsters.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E14 Annie Oakley: Rise of a Shooting Star After her father's death, nine-year-old Annie Oakley first picks up a rifle and begins shooting small game in order to feed her siblings and support her widowed mother. By her teenage years, Annie is so good at hunting that she begins supplying meat to a local grocery store, earning enough money to pay off her mother's mortgage. When famed sharpshooter Frank Butler comes to town for an exhibition, Annie accepts his challenge to participate in a shooting match. Not only does she win the match, but she wins Butler's heart as well. They are soon married, but they struggle to make it as a team on stage. A better shooter, Annie must become the main attraction for them to succeed. Years later, legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman Bat Masterson, tracks down Annie's husband to learn more about the rise of this shooting star.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E15 Charles M. Russell: The Cowboy Artist Charlie Russell is an aimless cowhand who loves the freedom of the cowboy way of life, and he is a self-taught artist who enjoys capturing the scenes of his rugged work on the range. Too embarrassed to ask people to pay for his paintings, he gives most of them away to friends or trades them for drinks at the saloon. But that changes quickly after he falls in love. Charlie's new bride Nancy gives him the encouragement he needs to stop cowboying in order to focus on his artwork. Under her watchful eye, he sobers up, stops cowboying, and improves his mastery of painting. Nancy is so proud of Charlie's talent that she doesn't hesitate to ask top dollar for his paintings. Years later, when legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman Bat Masterson tries to do a piece on Charlie, he quickly realizes that he must first deal with the woman behind the famous cowboy artist Charles M. Russell.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S2 E5 Joe Walker: Humble Hero Joe Walker doesn't head west to seek fame and fortune, but his trailblazing explorations across the uncharted frontier usher in a golden age of expansion and settlement that help create the United States as we know them today.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E10 Star Light, Star Bright As Christmas approaches, the riders fall victim to a con man, an old prospector named Cyrus, who promises them a half share in a gold mine. The riders help an impoverished family by celebrating the holiday with them.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S7 E8 Pocketful of Stars In order to bypass sacred Shoshone burial grounds, Cheyenne scouts land for the railroad. Cheyenne's deal doesn't satisfy the railroad foreman and others. They try to eliminate him by any means possible, including using a Chinese girl to poison him.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S7 E9 The Vanishing Breed Appointed to fill an empty seat in the senate, Cheyenne starts a campaign to preserve the American bison after a tragic buffalo stampede. He soon discovers that politics is really not his strong suit and should return as a gunfighter.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S1 E8 The Avenger Hoss and Joe desperately look for a way to prevent brothers Adam and Ben from being hanged for a crime. A stranger, Lassiter, comes to town in an attempt to find the truth and prove Adam and Ben's innocence.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E11 The Legacy Lucas agrees to do a good deed for Pop, the town drunk who is dying, by going along with a story that his ranch is owned by Pop. When Pop's son, Philip, arrives from back east the story backfires and now his son wants restitution.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E12 The Baby Sitter A dance hall singer asks for Lucas' help in hiding her 6-month-old baby girl from her estranged, self-righteous husband after he comes to town demanding she give the baby to him. Lucas must deal with the consequences of safeguarding the infant.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E13 The Coward George Collins, a meek young man who loves to write, moves west for adventure. However, he is soon fired as a trail cook and beaten up by trailhands. Lucas takes George under his wing to help him discover his true qualities and inner strength.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E14 Surveyors Mark overhears men plotting to rob the North Fork Bank while at a surveying camp and tells Lucas about what he heard. When Lucas questions his story, Mark runs away from home. Lucas later learns Mark was telling the truth and helps capture the men.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S7 E8 Gator Raid With new cattle operations in both south Florida and northern Alabama, the cowboys must divide and conquer in order to handle all of the work. In Florida, cattle are missing tails and calves are disappearing mysteriously, so Booger and Bubba head south to track down a predator. That leaves Cody to singlehandedly oversee an important cattle shipment at the ranch up north. Back at home, the guys convince Bubba to wear an empathy belly in hopes of teaching him to empathize with Kaley's pregnancy pain. The whole gang pitches in to help Matthew ace his school science project.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S7 E9 Specialty Sales and Recipe Fails As the cowboys continue to expand their operation, they round up some of their cattle in north Alabama and ship them down to greener pastures in south Florida. Cody and Misty are looking for extra income but they are unsure if they have enough time in their busy schedule to stage another specialty cattle sale. Bubba's hard work pays off when he finds a buyer for the ranch horses he's been training. Booger and Jaclyn struggle to recreate Grandma's recipes for a cowboy cookbook, so they call the families together for a taste test and some honest feedback.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E27 Guilty Conscience As soon as aging Leota Carraway and her teenage son, Hab, arrive in North Fork, they see Marshal Micah Torrance, who she takes as her long-lost husband who abandoned her 16 years ago. Lucas investigates and finds a gambler who looks just like Micah.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E28 Day of Reckoning North Fork welcomes new minister, Reverand Jamison, Lucas' enemy and a gunslinger who forced people off their land 25 years ago. Lucas soon realizes Jamison has reformed, but still faces danger from his past.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E6 Fool's Gold After discovering a river filled with gold, Jim Bridger and his fellow trappers believe they are near El Dorado, the mythical Spanish city of gold. But their insatiable greed turns friends into enemies and puts Bridger at risk of a gruesome fate.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E5 A Prince on the Prairie While guiding a hunting expedition, Jim Bridger must deal with an arrogant foreign prince who is abusing his servant boy. But the tables soon turn, when it's the prince who needs rescuing, and his only hope is the long-suffering servant boy.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E5 The Masterson Brothers Part 1 After Marshal Ed Masterson is shot while breaking up a barroom brawl, he hastily bans all firearms in Dodge City. Ed's swift proclamation is met with disdain by most townsfolk, including his own brothers, and places an even larger target on his back.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E6 The Masterson Brothers Part 2 After Marshal Ed Masterson is gunned down in Dodge City, his youngest brother, James, decides to follow in his footsteps and become a lawman. But when James' life is threatened, middle brother Bat Masterson races back from Arizona to protect his kin.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S2 E7 Jim Clyman: Frontier Survivor When he is separated from his trapping party, frontiersman Jim Clyman is 600 miles from the nearest fort. To survive the grueling trek, he must put his fate in the hands of Native Americans, without knowing if they will help him or kill him on sight.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S3 E8 Just Like Old Times On the anniversary of his brother's death, The Kid leaves the station to spend some time alone. Lou tracks him down to check on him. Later, the Kid's childhood girlfriend arrives in town, bringing back even more memories for him to deal with.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S7 E10 Vengeance Is Mine Cheyenne is the interim sheriff for the town of Gunnison. He quickly learns that his old friend Ray Masters wants revenge on Rod Delaplane due to a previous debt. Cheyenne must go to extreme measures to avoid tragedy.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S7 E11 Johnny Brassbuttons Scout Johnny Brassbuttons leads a wagon train, including a widow and her companion, to meet a stagecoach in Globe. Although they have permission to travel through Apache land, disaster strikes when Indians ambush them.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S1 E9 The Last Trophy A wealthy British couple visits the Ponderosa. The wife soon finds herself attracted to the toughness of the Cartwright men. She begins to think her husband is a coward and sets her sights on attracting Adam.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E15 Day of the Hunter A famous old frontiersman, with a reputation as the best rifleman around, challenges Luke to see who's really the best with a rifle.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E16 Mail Order Groom A mail-order husband arrives in North Fork, and finds not only a bride, but also harassment from two local troublemakers.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E17 A Case of Identity Aaron Wingate lost his wife and son in a river boat fire years ago. The boy was never found. Wingate hires two private detectives who come to North Fork and decide that Mark will fit the bill. Lucas must fight for custody.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E18 The Visitor A pretty young widow named Ann Dodd passes through North Fork on her way to claim her inheritance. She and Lucas are immediately attracted to each other, but danger awaits as other heirs try to take Ann's life to get the inheritance for themselves.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S7 E8 Gator Raid With new cattle operations in both south Florida and northern Alabama, the cowboys must divide and conquer in order to handle all of the work. Cody and Misty are looking for extra income but they are unsure if they have enough time in their busy schedule to stage another specialty cattle sale. Bubba's hard work pays off when he finds a buyer for the ranch horses he's been training. Booger and Jaclyn struggle to recreate Grandma's recipes for a cowboy cookbook, so they call the families together for a taste test and some honest feedback.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E27 Guilty Conscience As soon as aging Leota Carraway and her teenage son, Hab, arrive in North Fork, they see Marshal Micah Torrance, who she takes as her long-lost husband who abandoned her 16 years ago. Lucas investigates and finds a gambler who looks just like Micah.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E28 Day of Reckoning North Fork welcomes new minister, Reverand Jamison, Lucas' enemy and a gunslinger who forced people off their land 25 years ago. Lucas soon realizes Jamison has reformed, but still faces danger from his past.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E6 Fool's Gold After discovering a river filled with gold, Jim Bridger and his fellow trappers believe they are near El Dorado, the mythical Spanish city of gold. But their insatiable greed turns friends into enemies and puts Bridger at risk of a gruesome fate.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E5 A Prince on the Prairie While guiding a hunting expedition, Jim Bridger must deal with an arrogant foreign prince who is abusing his servant boy. But the tables soon turn, when it's the prince who needs rescuing, and his only hope is the long-suffering servant boy.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E5 The Masterson Brothers Part 1 After Marshal Ed Masterson is shot while breaking up a barroom brawl, he hastily bans all firearms in Dodge City. Ed's swift proclamation is met with disdain by most townsfolk, including his own brothers, and places an even larger target on his back.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E6 The Masterson Brothers Part 2 After Marshal Ed Masterson is gunned down in Dodge City, his youngest brother, James, decides to follow in his footsteps and become a lawman. But when James' life is threatened, middle brother Bat Masterson races back from Arizona to protect his kin.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S2 E7 Jim Clyman: Frontier Survivor When he is separated from his trapping party, frontiersman Jim Clyman is 600 miles from the nearest fort. To survive the grueling trek, he must put his fate in the hands of Native Americans, without knowing if they will help him or kill him on sight.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S3 E8 Just Like Old Times On the anniversary of his brother's death, The Kid leaves the station to spend some time alone. Lou tracks him down to check on him. Later, the Kid's childhood girlfriend arrives in town, bringing back even more memories for him to deal with.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S7 E10 Vengeance Is Mine Cheyenne is the interim sheriff for the town of Gunnison. He quickly learns that his old friend Ray Masters wants revenge on Rod Delaplane due to a previous debt. Cheyenne must go to extreme measures to avoid tragedy.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S7 E11 Johnny Brassbuttons Scout Johnny Brassbuttons leads a wagon train, including a widow and her companion, to meet a stagecoach in Globe. Although they have permission to travel through Apache land, disaster strikes when Indians ambush them.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S1 E9 The Last Trophy A wealthy British couple visits the Ponderosa. The wife soon finds herself attracted to the toughness of the Cartwright men. She begins to think her husband is a coward and sets her sights on attracting Adam.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E15 Day of the Hunter A famous old frontiersman, with a reputation as the best rifleman around, challenges Luke to see who's really the best with a rifle.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E16 Mail Order Groom A mail-order husband arrives in North Fork, and finds not only a bride, but also harassment from two local troublemakers.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E17 A Case of Identity Aaron Wingate lost his wife and son in a river boat fire years ago. The boy was never found. Wingate hires two private detectives who come to North Fork and decide that Mark will fit the bill. Lucas must fight for custody.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E18 The Visitor A pretty young widow named Ann Dodd passes through North Fork on her way to claim her inheritance. She and Lucas are immediately attracted to each other, but danger awaits as other heirs try to take Ann's life to get the inheritance for themselves.

programme.title: Christmas in the Smokies
programme.desc: Clinging to the only life she's ever known, a headstrong woman (along with her loving parents) finds herself on the verge of losing her family's berry farm in the heart of the Smoky Mountains, to an impending retail expansion. Over one eventful holiday season, she tries every avenue possible to save the farm. But, when the local town leaders notify her that they will have to seize the property after the holidays, her last hope to unite the town, is to throw a Christmas concert on the farm, headlined by her former love, a ne'er-do-well country music superstar. As the day of the concert approaches, they all must learn the value of family, faith and community - before time runs out.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E29 The Day a Town Slept Lucas and Mark return to North Fork after a hunting trip to discover Marshal Micah Torrance has been voted out. Smooth-talking newcomer Ben Judson is now in charge and his friendship with a wanted outlaw has Lucas suspicious.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E30 Milly's Brother Harry Chase moves to North Fork and courts Milly Scott, the owner of the general store. He impresses her with his heroic Civil War stories and claims he knew her brother who was killed in action. Lucas is suspicious and suspects he is a fraud.

programme.title: Legends of the Pony Express
programme.desc: Heroic Pony Express riders and station keepers face deadly terrain, hostile Native Americans, and dangerous outlaws to deliver vital mail across the untamed frontier. Their life-and-death adventures unite the country and become the stuff of legends.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E4 The Legend of Nat Love When Black cowboy Nat Love overnights in Deadwood during a cattle drive, he decides to enter a Fourth of July cowboy competition. Confident in his roping, riding, and shooting skills, he is eager to test his mettle against the best cowboys around.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E2 The Texas Fence-Cutting War When homesteaders keep cutting down her fences to access grazing land and water, a widowed landowner teams up with famed Texas Ranger Ira Aten to protect her property. Aten hopes his explosive plan of action will force the cutters to compromise.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S2 E3 Andrew Henry: Man of His Word Though Andrew Henry has little experience when he partners in a trapping expedition, he pledges his word to complete the risky venture. As Blackfeet warriors close in, he must weigh his personal integrity against the lives of the men he leads.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S3 E9 Spirits Rachel falls for a military division agent who has a drinking problem. When his issues start affecting her, Rachel reveals that she's had a problem with alcohol in the past. Meanwhile, with Teaspoon and other riders away, Noah heads a slim crew.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S1 E2 The Fear Merchants The Cartwrights help a Chinese-American stable hand who finds himself accused of murder. Opposing them is a manipulative mayoral candidate, Andrew Fulmer, a bigoted man who wants all foreigners to leave Virginia City.

programme.title: Country Roads Christmas
programme.desc: Recently fired, music executive Skye Sanderson must reluctantly work for a rival's record label right before Christmas and go on tour with the last artist she ever wanted to manage or spend time with for the holiday season... her father.

programme.title: High Lonesome
programme.desc: A sudden and swift series of murders occurs in southwestern Texas, sending Big Bend country into a frenzy. All parties are suspicious of a young rambler who just moved to the area, believing his presence must be related to the crimes.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E12 The Angry Gun Lucas and Mark, returning after selling their herd, share the stagecoach trip with a marshal and his prisoner, Johnny Cotton. Johnny's gang stops and robs the stagecoach, while Johnny steals Lucas' gun and profits. Lucas is forced to track him down.

programme.title: Christmas in the Smokies

programme.desc: S1 E12 The Angry Gun Lucas and Mark, returning after selling their herd, share the stagecoach trip with a marshal and his prisoner, Johnny Cotton. Johnny's gang stops and robs the stagecoach, while Johnny steals Lucas' gun and profits. Lucas is forced to track him down.

programme.title: Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: A homesteading family in 1867 Wyoming faces a crisis when the husband is killed and the wife must decide whether to remain or take her son and daughter back East.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S4 E7 Elijah Briant and the Wild Bunch When Elijah Briant is elected sheriff, the mild-mannered druggist and former teacher tries to enforce the law without carrying a weapon. But he soon faces his greatest challenge when the last surviving members of the Wild Bunch descend on his town.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S2 E8 The Abduction When Little Joe and Hoss spend an evening at the carnival, Little Joe's date, Jennifer Beale, disappears. The carnival owner has an eye for pretty girls and intrigues Jennifer. She learns that the attraction could prove fatal.

programme.title: Breed of Violence
programme.desc: Little Joe's friend, Dolly Kincaid, daughter of the town sheriff, is always falling in with the wrong kind. She becomes involved with Vince Dagen and soon finds out he is an outlaw. It's up to Joe to try and save her.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S3 E1 Anne Bailey: Horseback Heroine After Anne Bailey's husband is killed by Native Americans, she defies the social norms of the frontier and becomes a horseback courier, risking her life to race through hostile territory delivering vital supplies to isolated forts and settlements.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S3 E11 Al Jennings and the Legend of Dick West Tired of his boring life, attorney Al Jennings dreams of the adventures he reads in dime novels. After a chance encounter with Dick West, Jennings joins the outlaw's gang and learns that a life of crime isn't as glamorous as he thought it would be.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S3 E9 The Trials of Temple Houston Temple Houston, flamboyant son of Sam Houston, works hard to live up to his famous name as a top attorney in the Oklahoma Territory. But his flair for showmanship annoys his courtroom rivals, the Jennings brothers, and the feud erupts into bloodshed.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S7 E7 Dark Decision Cheyenne helps a blind woman named Constance Mason after a cattle stampede tramples her wagon. Once in town, she gets a job as a singer in a casino. She soon falls for a crooked gambler who is trying to pin a murder charge on Cheyenne.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E3 End of a Young Gun A young outlaw named Will Fulton saves Mark's life but breaks a leg in the process. He mends at Lucas' ranch, and there meets the lovely Ann Bard. The outlaw begins to soften and reassesses his choices and path in life.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E4 The Marshal Micah Torrance, formerly a famous marshal, who is now a drunk crippled from a gunfight, stumbles into North Fork. Lucas McCain hires him in hopes of rehabilitating the man. The good deed quickly backfires when outlaws arrive.

programme.title: Rage at Dawn
programme.desc: In 1866, the Reno Brothers gang is ravaging Indiana. When a detective agency sends a man to infiltrate the gang by posing as an outlaw, he sets a trap to capture the gang during an early-morning train robbery.

programme.title: Christmas in the Pines
programme.desc: Ariel thought she bought the perfect cottage for Christmas, but, through a mix-up, two offers were accepted on the house. As she battles Mark, the other buyer, Ariel realizes she may not only have found the perfect house, but also the perfect love.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E30 Milly's Brother Harry Chase moves to North Fork and courts Milly Scott, the owner of the general store. He impresses her with his heroic Civil War stories and claims he knew her brother who was killed in action. Lucas is suspicious and suspects he is a fraud.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E3 End of a Young Gun A young outlaw named Will Fulton saves Mark's life but breaks a leg in the process. He mends at Lucas' ranch, and there meets the lovely Ann Bard. The outlaw begins to soften and reassesses his choices and path in life.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E4 The Marshal Micah Torrance, formerly a famous marshal, who is now a drunk crippled from a gunfight, stumbles into North Fork. Lucas McCain hires him in hopes of rehabilitating the man. The good deed quickly backfires when outlaws arrive.

programme.title: Rage at Dawn
programme.desc: In 1866, the Reno Brothers gang is ravaging Indiana. When a detective agency sends a man to infiltrate the gang by posing as an outlaw, he sets a trap to capture the gang during an early-morning train robbery.

programme.title: Christmas in the Pines
programme.desc: Ariel thought she bought the perfect cottage for Christmas, but, through a mix-up, two offers were accepted on the house. As she battles Mark, the other buyer, Ariel realizes she may not only have found the perfect house, but also the perfect love.

programme.title: Savannah Sunrise
programme.desc: Joy Miles thinks she's taking a simple road trip to move her mother-in-law, Loraine, from Louisville to Savannah. Complete opposites, the two women manage to tolerate each other - barely. Type A+ personality, Joy is consumed with a high-stakes project at work. She has her days scheduled to the second. Now widowed, free-spirited Loraine is moving to a retirement community, no longer a preacher's wife, but a woman on her own. Her insights about life and family get under Joy's skin, challenging Joy to take a hard look at her whirlwind career and her priorities. As the weekend unfolds, with its outrageous adventures, hilarious encounters and heart-to-heart revelations, the women come to see each other through new eyes, and both women make an astounding discovery: they need each other more than they know.

programme.title: False Colors
programme.desc: The Kid enjoys a reunion with his long-lost brother, Jed. It seems as though Jed has found his place in the Army. However, he is actually posing as a cavalry member and is leading a gang to steal a gold shipment for the Confederacy.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E27 The Wrong Man A crooked marshal comes to North Fork looking for a wanted man. He finds a man fitting the futitive's description. He deliberately kills the wrong man to collect the bounty and then blackmails the real outlaw, who wants to keep his past hidden.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E28 The Challenge An escaped killer wants to prove he hasn't lost his nerve when he holds up North Fork's General Store and takes Marshal Micah Torrance hostage. He provokes the town to try to face him, but only Lucas is strong enough to rise up to his challenge.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E14 Annie Oakley: Rise of a Shooting Star After her father's death, nine-year-old Annie Oakley first picks up a rifle and begins shooting small game in order to feed her siblings and support her widowed mother. By her teenage years, Annie is so good at hunting that she begins supplying meat to a local grocery store, earning enough money to pay off her mother's mortgage. When famed sharpshooter Frank Butler comes to town for an exhibition, Annie accepts his challenge to participate in a shooting match. Not only does she win the match, but she wins Butler's heart as well. They are soon married, but they struggle to make it as a team on stage. A better shooter, Annie must become the main attraction for them to succeed. Years later, legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman Bat Masterson, tracks down Annie's husband to learn more about the rise of this shooting star.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E15 Charles M. Russell: The Cowboy Artist Charlie Russell is an aimless cowhand who loves the freedom of the cowboy way of life, and he is a self-taught artist who enjoys capturing the scenes of his rugged work on the range. Too embarrassed to ask people to pay for his paintings, he gives most of them away to friends or trades them for drinks at the saloon. But that changes quickly after he falls in love. Charlie's new bride Nancy gives him the encouragement he needs to stop cowboying in order to focus on his artwork. Under her watchful eye, he sobers up, stops cowboying, and improves his mastery of painting. Nancy is so proud of Charlie's talent that she doesn't hesitate to ask top dollar for his paintings. Years later, when legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman Bat Masterson tries to do a piece on Charlie, he quickly realizes that he must first deal with the woman behind the famous cowboy artist Charles M. Russell.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S1 E11 Quicksand In order to help a wagon load of traveling settlers in need of rescue and supplies, Cheyenne fights to show his courage against an Indian chief in a pit of swallowing sand. The first one to yell for help loses the fight.

programme.title: County Line: All In
programme.desc: The murder of a crooked lawyer on the county line forces two neighboring sheriffs to put aside their differences to take down the killer.

programme.title: Abilene Town
programme.desc: It's the late 1800s and a marshal must stop a volatile and growing conflict between homesteaders and cattle drivers in his small town on the Kansas frontier.

programme.title: The Proud Rebel
programme.desc: A Confederate veteran battles prejudice and greed as he helps a woman save her ranch from a land grab, while searching for a cure for his mute son.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E17 The Retired Gun Wes Carney, a famous gunfighter, and his new wife Clair move to North Fork. They open a store and settle down. However, three outlaws come to town to challenge him. Carney refuses and they ransack his store, forcing him to put his gunbelt back on.

programme.title: Savannah Sunrise

programme.title: The Proud Rebel
programme.desc: A Confederate veteran battles prejudice and greed as he helps a woman save her ranch from a land grab, while searching for a cure for his mute son.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S7 E10 Generations to Come Booger and Bubba struggle to keep up with ranch work while Cody is busy with his specialty cattle sale. Much to Bubba's chagrin, Booger hires their ornery old hand Billy to pick up the slack. Cody manages to pack the sale barn with potential buyers, but will they open their wallets for the high-end cattle? Bubba and Kaley turn their dining room into a playroom for their expanding family. Booger begins collecting old stories and memories from Grandma to accompany the recipes in her cowboy cookbook.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S7 E11 Let It Ripp The cowboys are busy processing cattle and preparing for an important shipment when a chute gets stuck, bringing work to a halt and risking time and money they can't afford to lose. Booger trains a cutting horse and enters it into its first competition. Cody organizes a campout for the youth at the Alabama Sheriff's Boys Ranch, and the guys share some of their cowboy wisdom with the hope of inspiring another generation to follow the cowboy way. Friends and family gather for a baby shower, where Bubba and Kaley reveal the name they've chosen for their new addition.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E31 Outlaw's Shoes Lucas rides to a nearby town to see the gunsmith to get a new spring for his rifle. On the way, two gunmen ambush Lucas, knocking him unconscious. When Lucas awakens, he has amnesia and thinks he is one of the outlaws, George Vale, who is wanted.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E32 The Executioner Russell Ganaway, a former neighbor of Lucas', is released from prison and asks for a job on the McCain Ranch. Years ago, Ganaway was found guilty of a robbing a stage and the money was never found. Lucas agrees but soon realizes he's hiding a secret.

programme.desc: Motocross racers Aaron Plessinger, Justin Barcia and Haiden Deegan.

programme.desc: While celebrating Friendship Day, the pups must prevent Mayor Humdinger from ruining Adventure Bay's reputation as the friendliest town on the map.

programme.title: The Addams Family
programme.desc: Members of the mysterious and spooky Addams family -- Gomez, Morticia, Pugsley, Wednesday, Uncle Fester and Grandma -- are readily preparing for a visit from their even creepier relatives. But trouble soon arises when shady TV personality Margaux Needler realizes that the Addams' eerie hilltop mansion is standing in the way of her dream to sell all the houses in the neighborhood.

programme.desc: Stacey takes an old, beat-up '66 Mustang and puts some pep back in Its step. He shows you how to replace an old automatic transmission with a quick-shifting Tremec T5 5-speed, and how to lift an old cab or body off a frame without destroying it.

programme.desc: He's been behind the wheel in everything from the 24 Hours of Le Mans to big Hollywood stunts; Kelly Collins joins Paul Tracy to share how a love of motorcycles sparked a career in some of the sport's biggest events with some of its biggest stars.

programme.title: The Charge: Mustangs at Le Mans
programme.desc: For the first time ever, the Mustang Challenge held an international round at the famed Circuit de la Sarthe, as nearly 40 Mustangs took to the iconic track and competed in the race of a lifetime. We meet the drivers, including Tanner Faust and Frankie Muniz, and chronicle all the on track action… in The Charge: Mustangs at Le Mans.

programme.title: Racers Unchained
programme.desc: From motocross domination with seven AMA national championships, to leading in the Indy 500 and jumping into Stadium Super Trucks and off road racing, Jeff Ward has done it all; he sits down with Paul Tracy for a conversation.

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: Stacey David takes automobile modification to a new level in "Gearz," pushing the limits of creativity and logic by building one-of-a-kind vehicles that defy conventional wisdom. Hot rods, off-road four wheelers, all-terrain types -- if it has an engine and a way to steer it, David, the original host of the popular TV series "Trucks!" brings it to life.
